details.description: You can claim online to get your State Pension paid directly into your bank account when you're within 4 months of your State Pension age
details.more_information:
s1. Wait till you get a letter from the Pension Service inviting you to claim your State Pension.
s2. Register to claim State Pension online through the [Government Gateway](https://www.dwpe-services.direct.gov.uk/en/statepensiononline "Register for the Government Gateway"){:rel="external"} - you may already have a Government Gateway login if you've requested a [pension statement.](/state-pension-statement \"State Pension statement\")
s3. When you get your Gateway ID and Activation Code in the post, you can activate the service and complete your State Pension claim.  
s4. You can only claim for yourself.
s5. You can save the form at any time and return to it later.

^When you register with the Government Gateway you get your ID and Activation Code in the post. ^

You may already have a login if you've requested a [pension statement](/state-pension-statement "State Pension statement"). 

##What you need when you make your claim

You'll need:

- your and your spouse's or civil partner's National Insurance number
- your current and 2 previous addresses 
- your tax reference number - you can find this on your P45, P60 or any letter from HM Revenue & Customs (HMRC)
- employment details (including addresses and dates of employment), if you've worked in the past 2 years 
- dates and social security numbers if you’ve lived or worked abroad
- the date of your marriage or civil partnership 
- dates if you’re divorced or your civil partnership has been dissolved 
- the date your spouse or civil partner died
- details of any benefits that you, your spouse or civil partner get 
- the number for the account you want your State Pension paid into 

^All the information you give will be kept confidential.^

*[NI]: National Insurance
*[HMRC]: HM Revenue & Customs

details.alternate_methods:
You can [claim by phone or by posting a form](/state-pension#how-to-claim "How to claim").

^You can only use this service if you are in England, Scotland or Wales. You need to use a different form for [claims in Northern Ireland.](http://www.nidirect.gov.uk/state-pension-online "Claim your State Pension online"){:rel="external"}^
